node.title: Verdict reached in Jussie Smollett trial
node.description: A verdict has been reached in the former "Empire" star's trial over an allegedly staged attack.
node.content: ["The jury in the trial of former \"Empire\" star Jussie Smollett has reached a verdict. Smollett is charged with six counts of disorderly conduct under a subsection of the law that prohibits false reports to police.\u00a0", "The verdict, which is expected to be announced in court shortly, is the culmination of nearly two years of controversy surrounding the actor and the hate crime he says occurred in January 2019.\u00a0", "The jury of six men and six women was tasked with determining whether Smollett lied to police about the alleged crime. Smollett, who is Black and gay, said two men beat him, yelled \"racist and homophobic slurs,\" dumped an \"unknown chemical substance\" on him and put a noose around his neck while he was walking to Walgreens late at night in Chicago. \u00a0", "But police and prosecutors alleged that Smollett paid two brothers, Abel and Ola Osundairo, $3,500 to help him stage the attack. Both brothers testified during the trial that Smollett asked them to carry out a fake attack.\u00a0", "Smollett also took the stand, telling jurors that he and Abel had a sexual relationship before the alleged attack and that his communications with the brothers the night of the attack were about scheduling a personal training session. Abel has denied having a sexual relationship with Smollett.\u00a0", "Smollett also repeatedly denied staging the attack, telling jurors, \"There was no hoax.\"\u00a0", "During closing arguments on Wednesday, prosecutors said they proved Smollett faked the attack with \"overwhelming evidence,\" CBS Chicago reported. Prosecutor Dan Webb also told jurors it was \"just plain wrong\" for Smollett to fake a hate crime.\u00a0", "\"To outright denigrate something as serious, as heinous, as a real hate crime \u2014 to denigrate it and then make sure it involved words and symbols that have such horrible historical significance in our country,\" Webb said.", "Webb also reiterated his doubts about Smollett's testimony, arguing that he would not have gone out to buy eggs at 2 a.m. on one of the coldest nights of the year and that the Osundairo brothers would not have been able to ambush him unless they knew his exact location, CBS Chicago reported.\u00a0", "\"They knew where he was going to be because they were told where to be,\" he said.", "Smollett's attorneys again denied the allegations, arguing that the prosecution's case \"is built like a house of cards,\" CBS Chicago reported.\u00a0", "Each count of disorderly conduct carries a sentence of up to three years, though legal experts told CBS Chicago that it's more likely he'll be sentenced to probation if he's convicted.\u00a0", "Charlie De Mar contributed reporting.\u00a0"]
